intro: Plagiogyria subrigida, commonly known as the rigid plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
